entries.title: Iran's supreme leader hints at loosening hijab rules after months of protests over young woman's death
entries.description: After months of protests, Iran’s supreme leader on Wednesday hinted that the government may loosen strict dress codes that helped trigger the demonstrations.

entries.title: Why Canada is making a major immigration push (Part 1)
entries.description: Canada’s government hopes to welcome nearly 1.5 million immigrants by 2025 to fill critical jobs. NBC News’ Julia Ainsley reports from Toronto on the recruitment push, especially in health care.

entries.title: Mexico's Mayan Train critically threatens ancient, pristine areas, scientists warn
entries.description: In Mexico, the Mayan train and its hasty construction will endanger wilderness and ancient cave systems, say droves of environmental experts and scientists.

entries.title: U.S. Embassy in Cuba reopening visa and consular services
entries.description: The United States Embassy in Cuba is reopening visa and consular services Wednesday, the first time it has done so since a spate of unexplained health

entries.title: Pope praises ‘gentle’ Benedict ahead of funeral
entries.description: Pope Francis praised Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI’s “acute and gentle thought” as he presided over a packed Wednesday general audience in the Vatican.

entries.title: Pope Francis pays tribute to Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI ahead of funeral
entries.description: Tens of thousands of people have visited Vatican City where Pope Emeritus Benedict XVI is lying in state ahead of his funeral to pay their respects to the late retired pope. NBC News’ Claudio Lavanga breaks down what to expect from the unprecedented funeral.

entries.title: Russia blames deadly missile strike on its soldiers using cell phones
entries.description: The Russian military has blamed its soldiers' use of cell phones for a Ukrainian missile attack that killed dozens and fueled a new round of domestic criticism.

entries.title: Watch: Cruise ship rescues migrants from crowded boat in Gulf of Mexico
entries.description: Video shared by the ship's captain showed crew members aboard Celebrity Beyond rescuing 19 migrants from an overcrowded boat Monday.

entries.title: Russia blames HIMARS attack on soldiers' cellphone use
entries.description: Russia's Defense Ministry said on Wednesday that 89 servicemen had been killed in the Ukrainian attack on Makiivka in the Moscow-controlled parts of the Donetsk region, adding the main reason for the attack was unauthorized use of cellphones by the troops.

entries.title: After New Year's Eve violence, German police union calls for action
entries.description: Germany’s biggest police union called for action to prevent a repeat of the violent excesses seen in Berlin and other cities during the New Year’s celebrations.

entries.title: Myanmar junta hits out at critics while thanking some countries for help
entries.description: Myanmar’s junta chief on Wednesday lashed out at countries for intervening in his country’s affairs while thanking others for “positively” cooperating.
